items.title: Welcome to the Sapienza Technology Team!
items.text: Paperino This is zensical.org.
path: Welcome to the Sapienza Technology Team!

items.title: Commands
items.text:
• zensical new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • zensical serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • zensical build - Build the documentation site.
  • zensical -h - Print help message and exit.
path: Welcome to the Sapienza Technology Team!

items.title: Project layout
items.text:
zensical.toml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
titolo.py
def puzza():

    return
path: Welcome to the Sapienza Technology Team!

items.title: Headers
items.text:
# H1 Header
## H2 Header
### H3 Header
#### H4 Header
##### H5 Header
###### H6 Header

items.title: Text formatting
items.text:
**bold text**
*italic text*
***bold and italic***
~~strikethrough~~
`inline code`

items.title: Links and images
items.text:
[Link text](https://example.com)
[Link with title](https://example.com "Hover title")
![Alt text](image.jpg)
![Image with title](image.jpg "Image title")

items.title: Lists
items.text:
Unordered:
- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item

Ordered:
1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

items.title: Blockquotes
items.text:
> This is a blockquote
> Multiple lines
>> Nested quote

items.title: Code blocks
items.text:
```javascript
function hello() {
  console.log("Hello, world!");
}
```

items.title: Tables
items.text:
| Header 1 | Header 2 | Header 3 |
|----------|----------|----------|
| Row 1    | Data     | Data     |
| Row 2    | Data     | Data     |

items.title: Horizontal rule
items.text:
---
or
***
or
___

items.title: Task lists
items.text:
- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [ ] Another task

items.title: Escaping characters
items.text: Use backslash to escape: \* \_ \# \`

items.title: Line breaks
items.text:
End a line with two spaces  
to create a line break.

Or use a blank line for a new paragraph.

items.title: How to Contribute to the Documentation
items.text:
Documentation is the lifeline of our Rover. Whether you are working on the robotic arm, the drone, or the science mission, documenting your work allows the team to grow and prevents knowledge loss.

This guide will walk you through setting up your computer to write, preview, and publish documentation using Zensical and GitHub.
path: How to Contribute to the Documentation

items.title: 1. Prerequisites & Installation
items.text: Before writing, you need to set up your "Development Environment". You only need to do this once.
path: How to Contribute to the Documentation

items.title: Step A: Install the Tools
items.text:
1. VS Code: Download and install Visual Studio Code. This is the editor we use.
  2. Git: Download and install Git.
    • Windows users: Select "Use Git from the Windows Command Prompt" during installation.
  3. Python: MkDocs runs on Python. Download Python 3.x.

    • Important for Windows

      During installation, make sure to check the box "Add Python to PATH" at the bottom of the installer window.
path: How to Contribute to the Documentation

items.title: Step B: VS Code Setup
items.text: Open VS Code and install these recommended extensions (click the square icon on the left sidebar): * Markdown All in One (by Yu Zhang) - Helps with shortcuts and table of contents. * Code Spell Checker (by Street Side Software) - Typos are unprofessional! * GitHub Pull Requests - Makes syncing easier.
path: How to Contribute to the Documentation
